history.content:
Sounds like a fun and challenging courseload. I know people who've done, seems worthwhile

-----

Did that exact schedule spring 2018 along with a few of my friends, plus some other folks who mix and matched two of the three. Was extremely fulfilling but exhausting.

Would only recommend if you have previously taken on heavy workload semesters or have prior experience with the material. Helps to have friends along for the ride so you can tackle problem sets together. You pretty much have two to three of HW/project/midterm due every week. If you only do school, it's probably doable, but if you want to also juggle clubs, recruiting or other commitments be prepared to make significant sacrifices.
Sounds like a fun and challenging courseload. I know people who've done, seems worthwhile

children.subject: followup to what classes you can take w/ 61c next semester -- maybe 186? It's been one of the lighter upperdivs for me personally
Thank you so much for your suggestions!  For the 186, the website says “Prerequisites: 61B and 61C.” How do you think the role that 61C plays in 186?
From what I've heard, 61C mostly gives context to 186 and enriches your experience but isn't particularly necessary to do well in the class.

Depends on the kind of challenging courseloads you've taken before. I personally wouldn't do this because both 126 and 127 have difficult psets and 61c is a fast-paced project-intensive class (from my experience this semester), but you can always sign up for all of them and then drop if it gets too much. Try to have a backup plan in case this happens!

history.content:
Is it possible to take CS 61C + EECS126 + EECS 127 together in fall 2019? Or are there any recommendations for courses to take with CS 61C for next semester?

Thank you in advance!
